schema_version.hidden comment: Bump the default in the subclasses.

step_run.description: Reference to analysis step run in pipeline
step_run.title: Analysis step run

___href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

quality_metric_of.description: One or more files that this metric either applies to or is calculated from.
quality_metric_of.title: Files

items.description: A particular file associated with this quality metric.
items.comment: See file.json for a list of available identifiers.
items.title: File

description: Schema for ChIP-seq alignment enrichment quality metrics
title: ChIP-seq alignment enrichment quality metric

___RSC.description: Relative cross-correlation coefficient. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at fragment length and at read length
___RSC.title: Relative strand cross-correlation coefficient

___pct_genome_enrich.description: The approximate percentage of the genome enriched in signal (e.g., bound by a transcription factor or having a certain histone modification).
___pct_genome_enrich.title: Percentage of genome enriched

___href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

___min_corr.description: Minimum cross-correlation over a sufficiently wide range of strand shifts (typically -100 bp to ~3 times the expected size of DNA fragments based on sonication and size selection protocols).
___min_corr.title: Correlation minimum

___ch_div.description: The CHANCE divergence between the replicate and the control.
___ch_div.title: CHANCE divergence

___syn_auc.description: The expected area under the curve of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed AUC into perspective.
___syn_auc.title: Synthetic AUC

___syn_elbow_pt.description: The expected elbow point of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed elbow point into perspective.
___syn_elbow_pt.title: Synthetic elbow point

___syn_x_intercept.description: The expected X-intercept of a perfectly behaved input sample having the same mean sequencing depth of a given sample. This is useful to put the observed X-intercept into perspective.
___syn_x_intercept.title: Synthetic X-intercept

___syn_jsd.description: The Jensen-Shannon distance between a given sample and a perfect input sample with the same coverage depth (i.e., the plot generated from the Poisson probability mass function with lambda equal to the mean coverage in the sample).
___syn_jsd.title: Synthetic JS distance

___auc.description: The “area under the curve”, with a maximum value of 0.5. Lower values generally indicate higher and more focal enrichment.
___auc.title: AUC of the plot

___href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

___elbow_pt.description: The elbow point attempts to measure the position at which the line turns upward. In practice, this is the point at which the plotted line is furthest from the line from the lower-left to the upper-right corner of the graph (equivalent to a perfect input sample with infinite coverage). The point returned is the position on the X-axis of this elbow point and higher values indicate more enrichment.
___elbow_pt.title: Elbow point

___diff_enrich.description: The differential enrichment between a given sample and that indicated by --JSDsample at the elbow point.
___diff_enrich.title: Differential enrichment

___corr_estimated_fragment_len.description: Value of correlation function at estimated fragment length.
___corr_estimated_fragment_len.title: Correlation at estimated fragment length

___NSC.description: Normalized strand cross-correlation = FRAGLEN_CC / MIN_CC. Ratio of strand cross-correlation at estimated fragment length to the minimum cross-correlation over all shifts.
___NSC.title: Normalized strand cross-correlation

___estimated_fragment_len.description: Fragment length/strandshift. This is the estimated fragment length/strand shift for each dataset as estimated by strand shift cross-correlation analysis
___estimated_fragment_len.title: Estimated fragment length

___x_intercept.description: The point (on the X-axis) at which the curve is 0. This is approximately the percentage of the genome that was not sequenced in a particular sample.
___x_intercept.title: X-intercept

___href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

___jsd.description: The Jensen-Shannon distance between the replicate and the control.
___jsd.title: JS distance
